comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: You are looking online from random people to learn about bitcoin so that you can invest in crypto? There are many gurus out there. YouTube is full with them. If you listen to them and starts putting your money then you will lose everything sooner. Most of them are just shilling with their affiliate links. There are not much things to learn about bitcoin. But a good read of the whitepaper will give you answer of a lot of questions you are looking for. This forum is also can help you to learn a lot about the history of bitcoin. And members are always willing to help you too. After all crypto started from bitcoin.Some boards for good readinghttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=37.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=4.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=14.0Not to mentions you will find a lot of geeks on WO as well.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178336.0.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: ajaxtempest on July 09, 2022, 02:34:40 PMI am not interested in trading but to be alert in current events. I know about BTC since 2011 though.If you really think that someone is posting some important information about Bitcoin on social networks, then you have not learned anything in the past 11 years. You can read everything important that is happening on this forum, and considering that you are not interested in trading, the speed of obtaining information should not be too important to you. Maybe you should look at the selection of various apps for smartphones that, in addition to the price, also have news aggregators so that you can always be up to date with what is happening. However, sometimes it can be quite irritating because you will be bombarded 24/7 with a bunch of news that will not have much sense and meaning.

comments.author: fiulpro
comments.body: Hi! If you are learning about cryptocurrencies like Bitcoins I would recommend you to understand what you want to learn first. Basics History Technical side etc. After that you can very easily go forth and look for these topics on the Google or YouTube as well, it's not something that you might find on just one channel, all i have done is honestly, search about these topics and see which explanation i like the most. There are so many sites that people named but for me YouTube and Google did wonders.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: fiulpro on July 09, 2022, 02:58:17 PMHi! If you are learning about cryptocurrencies like Bitcoins I would recommend you to understand what you want to learn first. Basics History Technical side etc. After that you can very easily go forth and look for these topics on the Google or YouTube as well, it's not something that you might find on just one channel, all i have done is honestly, search about these topics and see which explanation i like the most. There are so many sites that people named but for me YouTube and Google did wonders. I agree with you. It's a case of putting the cart before the horse when one who is starting in the cryptocurrency space jumps the basics, history, and the technical side. However, it is complimentary when you learn you are learning about the fundamentals and when you are staying updated with the latest happenings in cryptocurrency. If you are looking to learn the basics, I'd recommend Andreas M. Antonopoulos. He is a household name. There are a lot of resources on his Website: https://aantonop.com/Check out his YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/aantonopFor the latest news update, I enjoy watching CNBC.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Are you going to engage in trading and for this you want to be aware of all the events taking place in the crypto industry? If not, why do you need all this constant flow of information? You are already subscribed to some of them from your words. To know about the latest significant changes, it is enough to use this resource. One way or another, each event is covered here and discussed in the comments, in which, sometimes, you can learn something useful. Personally, it is a pity for me to spend so much time reading news from various sources on a daily basis. I allow this in the event that it is required to check different points of view.
